title: [BUG] - `paramiko[invoke]` no longer exists, though docs still refer to it
body:
### Are you using paramiko as a client or server?

Not sure

### What feature(s) aren't working right?

Something else

### What version(s) of paramiko are you using?

4.0.0

### What version(s) of Python are you using?

3.13.5

### What operating system and version are you using?

Gentoo Linux amd64

### If you're connecting as a client, which SSH server are you connecting to?

_No response_

### If you're using paramiko as part of another tool, which tool/version?

_No response_

### Expected/desired behavior

Behavior consistent with documentation.

### Actual behavior

The install documentation still refers to `paramiko[invoke]` extra:

https://github.com/paramiko/paramiko/blob/0e6a6510d5fb70b6537388841379a78d14d20044/sites/www/installing.rst?plain=1#L34-L36

However, this extra is no longer present as of 4.0.0:

https://github.com/paramiko/paramiko/blob/0e6a6510d5fb70b6537388841379a78d14d20044/pyproject.toml#L11-L21

### How to reproduce

```console
$ uv pip install 'paramiko[invoke]'
Resolved 7 packages in 4ms
░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░ [0/7] Installing wheels...                                                                                        warning: Installed 7 packages in 9ms
 + bcrypt==4.3.0
 + cffi==1.17.1
 + cryptography==45.0.5
 + invoke==2.2.0
 + paramiko==4.0.0
 + pycparser==2.22
 + pynacl==1.5.0
warning: The package `paramiko==4.0.0` does not have an extra named `invoke`
```

### Anything else?

_No response_
